section.title: Comments
section.para: Comments are sections of text that are ignored by the rule engine. They are stripped out when they are encountered, except inside semantic code blocks, like the RHS of a rule.

section.title: Single line comment
section.para: To create single line comments, you can use '//'. The parser will ignore anything in the line after the comment symbol. Example:
section.programlisting: rule "Testing Comments" when // this is a single line comment eval( true ) // this is a comment in the same line of a pattern then // this is a comment inside a semantic code block end

warning.para: Drools also supports for backward compatibility the use of '#' for single line comments, but this is deprecated and will be removed in future releases.

section.title: Multi-line comment
section.para: Multi-line comments are used to comment blocks of text, both in and outside semantic code blocks. Example:
section.programlisting: rule "Test Multi-line Comments" when /* this is a multi-line comment in the left hand side of a rule */ eval( true ) then /* and this is a multi-line comment in the right hand side of a rule */ end
